questions.question_text: A penetration tester needs to perform a vulnerability scan on a highly critical and fragile infrastructure system. Which of the following should the penetration tester do to minimize the risk?
A penetration tester discovers a login page during an assessment. Which of the following tools would the tester use to brute force a password?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Hydra because it's the only tool listed that pertains to brute-forcing
-Wireshark is a packet capturing, decoding, and analysis tool

-TinEye is a website that is designed for reverse image lookups

In the scoping phase of a penetration test, the most effective way for a penetration tester to obtain necessary information to begin testing is by sending a pre-engagement survey (also known as a scoping document) to the client to fill out.

questions.question_text: A penetration tester would like to know if any web servers or mail servers are running on the in-scope network segment. Which of the following is the best to use in this scenario?

During an engagement with a financial institution, a penetration tester found hard-coded credentials in a publicly accessible code repository. Those credentials allowed the penetration tester to access PII from many of the institution’s customers and services that are hosted by a cloud provider. Which of the following actions should the penetration tester do next?

choices.B: Keep the found credentials and use them during the engagement
choices.A: Proceed with the engagement and add the evidence in the final report
choices.C: Disclose the findings through a bug bounty platform
choices.D: Report the findings to the customer’s technical contact immediately

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Hard-coded credentials inside of a publicly accessible code repository that lead to PII would be considered a very critical vulnerability. This should be reported to the technical contact immediately to prevent further exploitation from adversaries
